programme.title: Ford Mustang vs Chevy Corvette
programme.desc: The search for the fastest, best looking and best sounding car continues. Once more car lovers from the Middle East bring their tuned vehicles to the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach and have it judged by Saif Hattawi. The winner receives a special treat for two people from the luxurious Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette try to win the competition.

programme.title: BMW X6M vs Nissan Patrol
programme.desc: Put Your Car on TV gives every car owner the chance to bring their tuned machines to the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah beach. There, Saif Hattawi will assess each car based on speed, style and sound. The person with the most amazing car wins a one night stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. A BMW X6M, a massive Ford F250 and a special Nissan Patrol try to win this prize.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Mercedes SLS vs Audi R8
programme.desc: Once more, Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi are on the hunst for the most amazing cars in the world and ask car owners to bring their customized vehicles to Dubai, where it will be awarded points based on speed, style and sound. The car with the points wins a stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. Among the presented cars are a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Lexus GSF vs McLaren MP4-12C
programme.desc: On Put Your Car on TV people from the Middle East present their tuned vehicles. They are rewarded with points based on its styling, the highest (possible) speed ever driven und naturally also its sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a luxurious treat from the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. This time, a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C are put on the spotlight.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Opel Kadett C Coupe, Part 1
programme.desc: The crew from BSG Racing knows a thing or two about spectacular conversions. Now the specialists have set themselves a special project. They want to really spruce up an old Opel Kadett C Coupe.

programme.title: Opel Kadett C Coupe, Part 2
programme.desc: The crew of BSG Racing wants to really spruce up an old Opel Kadett C Coupé. But they still have a lot of work to do before they get there. Today, the most important step of the conversion is coming up: the marriage.

programme.title: Opel Kadett C Coupe, Part 3
programme.desc: Before the presentation of their pimped Opel Kadett, BSG Racing are about to take the final steps, but there are only 6 days left. Will the guys still manage to finish the car in time?

programme.title: Opel Kadett C Coupe, Part 4
programme.desc: At Tuning World Bodensee, BSM Racing presents its finished Opel Kadett. Its conversion will compete against the best show cars in Europe in the European Tuning Showdown. Will the Kadett manage to take the tuning crown?

programme.title: World at Lake Constance
programme.desc: Tuning World Bodensee is a trade fair event in a class of its own. In 2013, a very special anniversary was celebrated: already 10 years earlier, the numerous tuning enthusiasts were drawn to Lake Constance for the start of the season.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: KTM 990 Adventure
programme.desc: It's very big and mostly comes in orange: the KTM 990 Adventure. Over rough terrain it's often driven standing up. Today, the 990 is considered the off-road specialist among travel Enduros.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: Episode 05
programme.desc: The Nürburgring is the place where you can really let your hair down on a spectacular and difficult race track and learn how to get fit for motor sports. This is the reason why motoring enthusiasts go there throughout the year.

programme.title: Episode 06
programme.desc: We prepared some very entertaining clips from the Nürburgring for you. Expect to see the pedal on the metal and rubber burning.

programme.title: Episode 08
programme.desc: When the weather cleared up a bit at the Nürburgring, we were finally back at the track. As soon as the snow and ice were gone the horsepower junkies returned to the ring to once again let their engines roar.

programme.title: Artega GT
programme.desc: From 2006 to 2012 the German company Artega produced their GT sports car model. Thanks to the know-how of a former Porsche and BMW manager the Artega GT was able to be manufactured in a small series.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 police car
programme.desc: This 1994 Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 is a former police car from the Los Angeles Police Department. Its curvaceous body was often mocked as looking like a whale, but this Chevy Caprice possesses the qualities of a shark.

programme.title: The best summer convertibles
programme.desc: Sun's out, guns out - time to flex your muscles! In the United States and Europe alike, people like to show off their fast and exciting sports cars. We present the five ultimate convertibles for hot summer days.

programme.title: Rare supercars
programme.desc: One of the most exclusive cars in the world is the Pagani Huayra. Its counterpart is the Rimac Concept One, the world's fastest electric car with a top speed of 355 km/h. The Lamborghini Huracan O.CT and Arden Jaguar F-Type promise raw power.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Auction Classics
programme.desc: Nowadays the gull-winged classic DeLorean is an automotive investment. Also: 100 dream cars under the hammer at a classic car auction in Switzerland. And: modern classics with investment potential like the Mercedes 190E 2.3 16V.

programme.title: Unique Classic Cars
programme.desc: The BMW 328 'Schlüter' wrote racing history in the 1930s. Today, the unique car is operational again. Also: the TVR 3000M Cosworth is able to scare any Porsche out of its mind. And: a 60 years old Opel Kapitän gets a makeover.

programme.title: Classic Cars Made in Japan
programme.desc: At the latest since a 1967 Toyota 2000 GT was sold at auction in the USA for 1.2 million dollars, Japanese classic cars have a different status. We present old and youngtimers "Made in Japan".

programme.title: Saab 93 and Saab 99 Turbo
programme.desc: In 1937 an airplane manufacturing company was founded in Sweden that later became the famous car manufacturer Saab. We present two of their iconic car models, the Saab 93 and 99 Turbo.

programme.title: Volvo Laplander 6x6
programme.desc: More extremes are always possible. Volvo's Laplander army vehicle has 6 wheels, 3 axles and provides space for at least 12 soldiers.

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: Ford Mustang vs Chevy Corvette
programme.desc: The search for the fastest, best looking and best sounding car continues. Once more car lovers from the Middle East bring their tuned vehicles to the Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach and have it judged by Saif Hattawi. The winner receives a special treat for two people from the luxurious Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. A Ford Mustang and a limited edition Chevrolet Corvette try to win the competition.

programme.title: BMW X6M vs Nissan Patrol
programme.desc: Put Your Car on TV gives every car owner the chance to bring their tuned machines to the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah beach. There, Saif Hattawi will assess each car based on speed, style and sound. The person with the most amazing car wins a one night stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. A BMW X6M, a massive Ford F250 and a special Nissan Patrol try to win this prize.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.desc: The Walk' at JBR, the most prestigious location in Dubai, sets the background for the fastest customized cars in the Middle East. Put Your Car on TV invites car owners to present their cars and have it judged. The owner of the fastest, most beautiful and best sounding car wins a special treat from Sofitel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. Among the competitors are a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet.

programme.title: Mercedes SLS vs Audi R8
programme.desc: Once more, Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi are on the hunst for the most amazing cars in the world and ask car owners to bring their customized vehicles to Dubai, where it will be awarded points based on speed, style and sound. The car with the points wins a stay at the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach for two people. Among the presented cars are a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: Lexus GSF vs McLaren MP4-12C
programme.desc: On Put Your Car on TV people from the Middle East present their tuned vehicles. They are rewarded with points based on its styling, the highest (possible) speed ever driven und naturally also its sound. Whoever receives the most points, wins a luxurious treat from the Sofitel Hotel Dubai Jumeirah Beach. This time, a Lexus GSF, a Ford Mustang and a McLaren MP4-12C are put on the spotlight.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: The BMW Story
programme.desc: The emphatically sporty cars and motorbikes of BMW are equally successful with customers and in racing. However, the former aircraft engine manufacturer's entry into automobile production threatened to fail at an early stage.

programme.title: Porsche 550 Spyder
programme.desc: The Porsche 550 Spyder is small and fast, but only 140 units were built. It was Porsche's first racing sports car and laid the foundation for the German manufacturer to be considered a force in car racing today.

programme.title: Ford Motorsport
programme.desc: Racing has been a matter of the heart for Ford for over 100 years. Henry Ford already wins the first race with his first car. Thousands of other victories were to follow.

programme.title: BMW Racing
programme.desc: The development of engineering at BMW has always been closely linked to motorsport. Racing has always played a decisive role in shaping the brand and setting the pace for its future.

programme.title: Porsche Racing
programme.desc: In the 1980s and 90s, Porsche races from victory to victory. A McLaren with Porsche engine wins the Formula 1 World Championship three times. In Le Mans in 1982, Porsche starts an unbelievable winning streak with the new 956/962 prototype.

programme.title: Glas 1700 GT
programme.desc: The Glas GT looks like a Ferrari, but comes from the province of Lower Bavaria in Germany. In the early 1960s it was one of the few German sports cars.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: The Yas Marina Story
programme.desc: The Yas Marina Circuit in Abu Dhabi is the most glamorous race track of the Formula One. Khaled Qubaysi takes us for a spin on this exclusive behind-the-scenes look at the famous race track.

programme.title: Team X-Raid at the Dakar Rally
programme.desc: Stéphane Peterhansel is the most successful driver in the history of the Dakar Rally. With the German team X-Raid he won the 2012 and 2013 editions of this prestigious competition in a Mini Countryman.

programme.title: Pikes Peak
programme.desc: For more than a century man and machine have tried to tame the Pikes Peak mountain, where daredevils risk everything to be the fastest up the 20-kilometer road to the summit at 4,300 meters above sea level. We show you the highlights of the 2018 race.

programme.title: Ice action in Finland
programme.desc: Former World Rally champion Armin Schwarz is a legend behind the wheel. We accompanied him when he instructed other talented drivers in a Subaru WRX STI rally car in the snowy and icy, but also breathtaking landscape of Finland.

programme.title: Isle of Man Tourist Trophy 2015
programme.desc: The Tourist Trophy on the British Isle of Man is the most famous motorcycle race in the world. TT Sidecar champion Klaus Klaffenböck and racing expert Lenz Leberkern explore the fascination behind this exciting and iconic racing event.

programme.title: BMW Active Hybrid 7
programme.desc: With the Active Hybrid 7, unlike with its predecessor bearing the same model name, BMW now banks on a full hybrid, which can also be driven solely with electric power.

programme.title: Maserati Quattroporte GTS
programme.desc: 1963, over 50 years ago, with the Quattroporte Maserati invented a new vehicle category, the sports sedan. This GTS model is already the 6th generation of this iconic car.

programme.title: The Beauty is a Beast
programme.desc: We took the Mercedes AMG SLS GT to an airfield and the Porsche 911 Turbo S to the racetrack in order to see these sporty driving machines in action and test their performance. In addition: the Audi R8 4.0 TFSI's innovative lighting technology.

programme.title: Jaguar F-Type
programme.desc: Jaguar found their way back to the world of sports cars. The F-Type doesn't just look good, it's got what it takes, and the car is able to take on the competition like the BMW Z4. We also took a closer look at two other competitors, the Porsche Boxster S and Nissan's 370 Z.

programme.title: Muscle Cars
programme.desc: For more than 60 years the Corvette has been the embodiment of the American sports car. Also: the Ford Mustang GT, an iconic model with a V8 engine at the price of a Volkswagen Passat. And: the Chevrolet Camaro, another classic from the land where cylinder capacity is still valued a lot.

programme.title: Lamborghini Huracan by O.CT
programme.desc: A lot of power thanks to a compressor. This optimized O.CT Lamborghini Huracán delivers over 800 horse power to get the blood flowing.

programme.title: Morgan ARP4
programme.desc: Since 1950, the exhilarating Morgan +4 has been the mainstay of Morgan production. The ARP4 is the latest addition to the +4 family and strictly limited to a run of 50.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: The Fastest Cars in the World
programme.desc: We show what's hot and what's not in the car world. This time we focus on the fastest cars.

programme.title: The Most Expensive Production Cars
programme.desc: Real luxury, the kind of cars most people can only dream of. We present the most expensive production cars.

programme.title: The Ten Slowest Cars
programme.desc: We present the ten heaviest cars. But there are not only heavy bodies or big vans to see. We have a few surprises up our sleeves.

programme.title: The Most Unusual Cars of Modern Times
programme.desc: Day after day, the research and development departments of car manufacturers are working to make their upcoming models unique. We present the ten most unusual cars of the last few years.

programme.title: The Most Successful Cars in the 24h Race
programme.desc: The 24-hour race at Germany's Nürburgring is one of the most famous and dangerous endurance races in the world. We show those cars that have won the most titles.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: Fuel prices continue to rise. That's why in this episode we present ten of the most fuel-efficient cars in the world.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: Man vs. Machine
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes team plan to create a clash between man and machine. For a stunt showreel one of Action Concept's stunt people will be facing a new BMW 3 series in an action-packed chase.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: It's getting hot in this episode of Stunt Heroes. Stuntman Paul will be engulfed by flames as everything around him blows up in this dangerous fire stunt. The Action Concept team carefully prepares for this heated scene.

programme.title: Bodyfights
programme.desc: For a showreel, the team choreographs a fight that involves hand-to-hand combat, glass bottles shattering on heads and bodies crashing through walls. In the end, a car flies high, detonates in the air, leaving a trail of destruction.

programme.title: The Flying Quad
programme.desc: Action Concept wreck more than 100 cars each year for their stunts. In this episode, a quad rider is chased by a car. The car is crashed in the process and the quad bike also has to be destroyed, but the question is how?

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: In this episode of Stunt Heroes, it's all about stunt driver Christoph Knobloch. He drives down a ramp and crashes into cars stacked on top of each other while several petrol barrels explode at the same time.

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: Rimac Concept One
programme.desc: The futuristically designed Rimac Concept One is one of the fastest, most powerful and expensive electric cars in the world, it does not adhere to convention.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: The Audi Story
programme.desc: Audi is one of the most successful car manufacturers of the present day. The brand with the four rings stands for innovation, superior technology and unique design. Founded over 100 years ago, Audi is now a successful global player.

programme.title: Auto Union
programme.desc: In 1932, the economic crisis led to the merger of the Horch, DKW, Audi and Wanderer brands under the name Auto Union, the second largest German car manufacturer at the time, which made motor sport history with the famous Silver Arrow racing cars.

programme.title: Ford - The Beginning of the Modern Era
programme.desc: Henry Ford paved the way for the automotive revolution at the beginning of the 20th century. With the Ford Model T, the company conquered not only the USA but the whole world and made its inventor one of the richest men.

programme.title: Ford - Two Countries, One History
programme.desc: Few manufacturers have been as active in the USA and Europe as early as Ford - and with success. While the Mustang thrilled American youth, the Capri turned the heads of Europeans.

programme.title: Porsche at Le Mans
programme.desc: Porsche has competed in the 24-hour Le Mans classic every year since 1951. The company's prototypes have won 18 times - more often than the vehicles of any other manufacturer in the history of this racing series.

programme.title: BMW 328 Schlüter
programme.desc: If a car arrives in a trailer, its value is usually very high. The original BMW 328 Schlüter is already rare and expensive. But this model is a reconstruction and it is absolutely unique.

programme.title: Volvo XC60
programme.desc: The Swedish landscape is characterized by mountains, forests and lonely roads. Ideal for this off-roader. The Volvo XC60 scores with many safety features and a cool appearance.

programme.title: G-Power M5
programme.desc: The G-Power M5 Hurricane RS Touring is one of the fastest station wagons in the world. Also: the Artega GT. And: the Austin FX4.

programme.title: Mechatronik
programme.desc: The company Mechatronik is dedicated to the restoration and refinement of Mercedes-Benz classics. Also: the Nissan 370 Z takes on Porsche Cayman & Co. And: the Chevrolet Camaro and the Mercedes-AMG ML 63.

programme.title: Wiesmann MF 5
programme.desc: The MF5 GT, the powerhouse from Wiesmann. What's more: if you're looking for exclusivity and find even the performance of a Mercedes-AMG too low, you've come to the right place. The Brabus company is one of the most famous tuners in the world.

programme.title: Geneva Motor Show
programme.desc: The International Motor Show in Geneva is the first important vehicle fair of the year. Of course, the top class refiners must not be missing. Also: the Mercedes-AMG SL 63. The sixth generation of the SL is more powerful than ever before.

programme.title: MTM
programme.desc: The tuning forge MTM is known for its extremely dynamic, optimally tuned vehicles. What's more: the Nissan Juke-R is a projectile with the dimensions of a cigar box and 485 hp of power.

programme.title: Mercedes-AMG GT S Performmaster
programme.desc: Not far from Stuttgart is the home of the tuner Performmaster who specialize in the performance optimization of Mercedes-AMG models. They turned the already more-than-potent GT S sports car into a beast.

programme.title: Lancia Stratos HF
programme.desc: The Lancia Stratos with Ferrari power, the rally icon of the 1970s.

programme.title: Ken Block - Gymkhana Grid
programme.desc: Spectacular drifts are to be expected when Ken Block visits the Gymkhana Grid.

programme.title: The Fastest Cars in the World
programme.desc: We show what's hot and what's not in the car world. This time we focus on the fastest cars.

programme.title: The Most Expensive Production Cars
programme.desc: Real luxury, the kind of cars most people can only dream of. We present the most expensive production cars.

programme.title: The Ten Slowest Cars
programme.desc: We present the ten heaviest cars. But there are not only heavy bodies or big vans to see. We have a few surprises up our sleeves.

programme.title: Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: Hidden Hillclimbers
programme.desc: A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: 12 Hours and Running
programme.desc: “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.title: Diamond in Dodge City
programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: Biker Lore
programme.desc: Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: Vegas Payday
programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: Second Time's a Charm
programme.desc: The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project
programme.desc: Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: Orphan Bikes
programme.desc: Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: 100 Year Old Harley
programme.desc: “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: Hidden Hillclimbers
programme.desc: A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: 12 Hours and Running
programme.desc: “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Meet the Team
programme.desc: Get an exclusive look into the operations at Down Home Harley-Davidson, from sales to service. After, the crew gets together for 'Bike Night' at Lucky's bar, and gets roped into some wild biker games.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Hot Rods & Bitchin' Bikes
programme.desc: Dan and the crew plan their first big Saturday event: a massive car and motorcycle show at the dealership. Special guest Dave Kindig arrives to check out some cars and judge the competition

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Meeting The King
programme.desc: Dan and Ellen get an exclusive invitation to the Richard Petty Museum to meet the 'King of Nascar' himself - Richard Petty. Petty gives a personal tour of his childhood home and garage. Back at Down Home, Rama leads a big ride into the mountains.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs 104 Bar Hopping
programme.desc: Tensions run high at the dealership as the crew plans their next big Saturday event - The Bootlegger's Run. Dan worries about the weather while he and Ellen meet with bar owners to get them on board with the ride.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs The Bootleggers Run
programme.desc: The Moonshiners arrive at Down Home for its biggest charity ride of the year. Excitement (and chaos) erupts at the dealership while Dan and the crew manage the unexpected crowd.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Tearing Up the Course
programme.desc: The King Richard Petty invites Dan to compete in The Richard Petty Charity Golf Classic. To 'up his game,' Dan gets a golf lesson from the best in the business. Will it be enough to impress his teammates?

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Season Finale
programme.desc: Dan looks back on the dealership's performance over the past year, and continues his quest for Down Home to become #1 in the country. Will he succeed? Or does he still have some work to do?

programme.title: Modifying a Polaris Ranger UTV/Side-By-Side
programme.desc: One of the hottest vehicles to hit the gear head world is the Side-by-Side, or Utility Vehicle. Once relegated to just farm or ranch work, the UTV is now something that you will see being used for Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Landscaping….virtually ANY kind of outdoor work or recreation. Of course that means the aftermarket is full of things to make an UTV better. Today on GEARZ, Stacey takes a Polaris Ranger and decks it out with a 3 ½” lift, bigger tires and axles, winches front and rear, and all kinds of other cool things to build an all-terrain vehicle that will really shine on the trail or off. After that he gives you a sneak peek at the new Ironworker that has everybody talking. If you work a lot with metal, you need this machine!

programme.title: Drving the Drag N Wagon
programme.desc: Stacey puts a programmer on the Drag ‘N’ Wagon to finally bring the stripped down Ram Hot Rod truck to life. If you’ve been wondering what kind of performance potential these new Ram Express trucks have, wait until you see one lit up with a supercharger! Talk about breathing fire! After that Stacey lays out how to set up a shop with custom flooring, custom cabnets, and of course a lot of tools and toolboxes. If you’ve ever wondered about the best way to lay out a shop, and utilize your space, this is the show to see… and GEARZ is the show to watch!

programme.title: Hot Rod Tow Truck
programme.desc: Project Heavy Metal is back as Stacey rolls the International Cabover truck into the shop so he can outfit it with a vintage Holmes dual wrecker bed. The big truck continues to come together using parts from a junkyard wrecker, swap meet vintage beer kegs, and some new aftermarket parts. If you always thought that you had to spend big money to build a unique vehicle, this “Heavy Metal” truck will change your mind, and probably have you digging through junkyards in hopes of finding a vintage truck of your own!

programme.title: Long Bed Into Short Bed
programme.desc: Everybody wants a classic short bed pickup. Unfortunately, short beds are hard to find for a good price… but long beds are a dime-a-dozen, and cheap! The solution?... chop a long bed down! That is exactly what Stacey does on this episode of GEARZ. He takes a classic 67 Chevy long bed, and walks you through the way to cut the frame properly, so you have a safe and reliable truck when you are done. If you’ve heard about this kind of modification, but always thought it was too difficult or involved for you to do, you need to watch this episode of GEARZ and let the cutting begin!

programme.title: Monn Buggy Race
programme.desc: Who put men on the moon? If you answered “Gearheads” then you are right… of course, we call them engineers and rocket scientists now. But that doesn’t change the fact that a bunch of hot rodders figured out how to get America into Space, and Stacey takes a look at the roots of the Space Program, and the invention of the moon buggy. Then it’s out to the NASA testing grounds to see the annual Moon buggy race. If you think you’ve seen some weird projects, wait until you see what some of these young minds have dreamed up. You may think you’re on another planet, but you’re not… you’re watching GEARZ!

programme.title: Short Bed Classic Truck
programme.desc: Stacey picks up right where he left off a few weeks ago and proceeds to install a brand new short bed, on the chassis of a truck that was born a LONG BED. That’s right, with the cutting done, the next step is to assemble a new short bed using all new aftermarket parts. You hear people say, “if it was that easy, everybody would be doing it!” Well, it IS that easy, and a lot of people ARE doing it… and YOU need to be one of them! Now… chop to it!

programme.title: P38 Lightning
programme.desc: It was one of the most lethal airplanes of WWII… the P-38 Lightning. Stacey takes a look at what made it so unique and why the German army nicknamed it the “Forked tailed devil”. But the legend didn’t end in the 1940’s… it continues on as Stacey showcases the new P-38 engine parts from Jon Kaase that you can put on your small block Ford to make it run like greased lightning! After that, Stacey sits down with Rock and Roll legend and certified car nut, James Burton, to dig into the unique connection between cars, guitars, and Rock and roll. Turn it on… crank it up… and hold on!

programme.title: Lawn & Garden
programme.desc: Some of the most neglected tools around the house are lawn and garden tools. Mowers, weed-eaters, chain saws, etc. all usually get thrown in a garage in the fall, never to be touched again until spring. Stacey walks through the simple steps on how to care for those tools, so they give you years of trouble free service. After that, He goes through the many parts you will need to put a manual transmission into a project, with Transmission Tech. Finally, if you’re looking for a simple project to do over the weekend, how about a muffler swap? You say “no”?... Stacey says “yes.”

programme.title: V8 Interceptor Paint and Body
programme.desc: The V8 Interceptor is BACK and wearing a striking coat of glossy black paint! How did it happen? Well, Stacey walks you through the process and shows off the incredible paint and body work that was done by the Hot Rod Institute. From the subtle body nips and tucks, to the major fabrication of a new roof, this classic Cougar now has a straighter body than anything that may have rolled off the assembly line in 1967! But the paint is only half the story, as Stacey starts to re-assemble the car with bumpers, lights and engine, you start to get a good look at what is rapidly becoming the ultimate street predator!

programme.title: Heavy Metal Winches
programme.desc: What is cooler than a vintage tow truck? … Nothing! Stacey proves that point by rolling Heavy Metal back into the GEARZ shop to outfit it with new electric winches, and an amazing custom tool box and light bar. This ’69 International cabover truck may have been rescued from a junkyard, but it won’t be long before this truck starts pulling off rescues of its own! This is recycling at it’s best! Then ride along with Stacey and crew as they travel to Minnesota and get the story on Edwards Manufacturing and how they have managed to stay in business for over a hundred years building simple tools. It’s all good, and it’s all GEARZ!!

programme.title: Ray Barton Story
programme.desc: When you say “HEMI”, you get people’s attention! But when you say “Ray Barton HEMI” you win races. Stacey and crew take you to Ray Barton Racing Engines to show you the amazing engines and parts they build, and why they go so fast. After that, Stacey digs into the interior of the V8 Interceptor and shows what kind of options you have when you are restoring or customizing the interior of your project. You’ll love the custom PRS guitar and matching wood dash and steering wheel! There is no doubt that this Cougar is the perfect blend of brutal power, and sophisticated elegance.

programme.title: Magnus Walker's Secret Porsche Collection
programme.desc: Porsche collector, customizer, and Urban Outlaw, Magnus Walker is a world-wide rock star to fans of the German car company. So, when Caffeine & Octane producers invited him to travel cross country to tell the story of a hidden Porsche collection tangled in a North Georgia Vineyard, they were surprised when he signed on. No sour grapes here, what Walker found at the Wolf Mountain Winery will impress even those with the most refined palette for Porsches.

programme.title: Chipper Jones' International Car Show
programme.desc: A Hall of Famer?s search for an Exotic Car that fits; a blind man?s ?touchy feely? approach to seeing great cars.

programme.title: Fuller's "2029" Majestic Build
programme.desc: Back to the future with a Majestic build from Fuller Moto that showcases 3-D printed parts, an electric motor, and hub-centric steering.

programme.title: The Fastest Man on Two Wheels
programme.desc: Horsepower and million-dollar sticker shock, from two and four wheels, dominate this edition of C & O.

programme.title: Power Play: Proline's Search for 3000+ HP
programme.desc: A need for speed in a Sleepy Georgia town has engineers pushing the boundaries to exceed 3000 horsepower.

programme.title: Turn of the Century Cars
programme.desc: Turn of the century cars?with wooden wheels?at 85mph?oh my!

programme.title: Hot Wheel's & an Urban Outlaw
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw and designer Magnus Walker weighs in on his beloved Porsche and the legend of Hot Wheels.

programme.title: Proving Provenance on a One-Off Ferrari
programme.desc: Tracing the origins and solving the mystery of a controversial all-aluminum bodied 512 BBI Boxer Ferrari.

programme.title: Twin City Turbos
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane goes Turbo in the Twin Cities; Ferrari Drifter Federico Sceriffo finds a home in Atlanta.

programme.title: 470MPH with Custom King George Poteet
programme.desc: Jaguar F-Type Project 7 crosses the Pond.

programme.title: Art & Oddities at Old Car City, USA
programme.desc: Mustang Mayhem at the big show.

programme.title: The Unsung Hero in the Movie Ford v. Ferrari
programme.desc: Red carpet receptions for a Koenigsegg Regera.

programme.title: Go for It!
programme.desc: Holly asks Mark if she can work on cars. Mark Cain from Bad Boy Blasters brings the crew a huge gift. The '70 Barracuda Convertible is torn down and sent to the dipper, progress is made on the '70 Sunroof Challenger and Mark gets a surprise from one of his favorite actors.

programme.title: Get Your Hands Dirty
programme.desc: Mark installs the hood decal on the '70 Sunroof Challenger, Holly helps Josh disassemble the Barracuda suspension, Mark and Daren work on the 440 engine for the Challenger, and the team assembles one of the rarest Mopar options, the sunroof for the '70 Challenger.

programme.title: W-O-M-A-N, Mark Woman
programme.desc: The team rushes to ready the '69 Dodge Daytona for Tom Partridge and his family's visit. The guys settle a leadership dispute the old fashioned way, the Graveyard Carz van gets a face lift, and Daren retaliates when Mark won't let him sign for deliveries.

programme.title: Pop Secrets
programme.desc: Holly helps Mark on the '70 Challenger, Daren annoys everyone with his popcorn and causes Mark to damage a very rare car. Tony D'Agostino, from Tony's Mopar Parts, visits and lends a hand on the '70 sunroof Challenger. Mark let's Holly in on the big secret and Daren reveals a secret of his own.

programme.title: Let the Sunshine In
programme.desc: Mark gets a portable showroom, the '70 Hemi Charger is dissembled and the team finishes the 1970 Sunroof Challenger. Mark finally reveals his big secret project to the Graveyard Carz team and Royal makes a video tribute to the Sunroof Challenger.

programme.title: The Royal Treatment
programme.desc: Mark and the ghouls build out the 440 Super Commando engine for their '70 Plymouth Superbird and install the suspension for the '69 Daytona Charger. Daren finally has enough of Marks foolishness.

programme.title: The Grand Torino
programme.desc: Body man Derrick becomes an official Graveyard Carz crew member and assists in the disassembly of the rare '67 Plymouth Hemi GTX Convertible. Josh and Daren play "the game" with Mark.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghouls get a massive sheet-metal order from AMD for their '70 Plymouth Superbird. Meanwhile, the owners of the '72 Charger visit and talk about what made their car so special. Daren gets the offer of a lifetime on his '70 Challenger R/T.

programme.title: It's the Great Pumpkin, Goldberg!
programme.desc: It's a Moparween at Graveyard Carz! Just when things couldn't get crazier, Bill Goldberg shows up to go over his '68 GTX Convertible and knock some sense into the guys. He can handle the NFL and the WCW, but can he hold his own at GYC?

programme.title: Daytona Reborn Pt. 1
programme.desc: Mark is behind on his promise to get Tom Partidge's '69 Daytona Charger finished by the end of the month. The crew kicks into high gear to get Tom's Daytona looking great and out the door.

programme.title: Daytona Reborn Pt. 2
programme.desc: Mark is behind on his promise to get Tom Partridge's '69 Daytona Charger finished by the end of the month. The crew bands together to do whatever is necessary to fulfill Mark's promise to the owner and bring it back to life.

programme.title: Episode 1
programme.desc: The Ghoulz pay tribute to their favorite moments over the previous seasons. This special episode looks back over seasons 1-3 of Graveyard Carz, but includes all new interviews to highlight some previously unrevealed details.

programme.title: The Elephant in the Room
programme.desc: A 1970 Dodge Charger engine is restored in this Special episode.

programme.title: Daren and Royal Go Topless
programme.desc: A rare 1970 Charger and a 1970 Barracuda 383 are featured.

programme.title: General Disassemble Lee
programme.desc: A 1968 Charger, a 1970 Challenger R/T, and a 1969 Charger are featured.

programme.title: Mo Money Mo Challengers
programme.desc: A 1972 Dodge Charger is restored.

programme.title: Drive a Mile in My Shoes
programme.desc: A 1969 Road Runner is featured.

programme.title: Top Banana Charge
programme.desc: Work on a 1972 Dodge Charger is continued.

programme.title: Gone Bananas
programme.desc: The story about the 1972 Charger is briefly revisited, and past work leading to its completion is also revisited. Work on the 1972 Dodge Charger is completed and revealed to the owners.

programme.title: Manifold Destiny
programme.desc: The 1970 Plymouth Superbird work is resumed, and the 1970 Charger R/T collision repair is completed. The 1970 Barracuda Convertible's 383 2bbl. V8 is assembled and painted.

programme.title: Spoiler Alert
programme.desc: A secret is accidentally revealed by Mark. Mark and Daren visit the local AAMCO Transmissions to watch the overhaul of the 1970 Barracuda Convertible's 727 Automatic Transmission, and then the Barracuda has its A/C box and instrument panel installed. The 1970 Superbird assembly nears completion.

programme.title: MoSparring
programme.desc: Automotive parts supplier Tony D'Agostino of Tony's Parts helps the shop get organized, and Mark tests his Mopar knowledge against Tony's. Work on a 1970 Plymouth Superbird is completed.

programme.title: The Hills Have Eyes on a Superbird
programme.desc: The 1970 Superbird's restoration and story is recapped, and the Hills visit the shop to take delivery of the car, along with its original owner. Mike and Michael Hill drive the Superbird on a cross county trip home to South Carolina.

programme.title: Clipped Wings
programme.desc: With the 1970 Plymouth Superbird done and safely driven home, Mark is asked to restore a 1969 Daytona Charger. Due to its condition, Mark questions if it's practical and if it's even legal.

programme.title: Put Me In, Coach
programme.desc: Just when things couldn't get more stressful, Mark agrees to finally get the 1930 Chevy Coach fully restored by the end of the week. Meanwhile, Mark QC's the next cars in the process of resurrection.

programme.title: How to Cook a Barracuda
programme.desc: See the complete 3-year restoration of Kimberly Cook's 1970 Barracuda Convertible: the body, paint, engine, and convertible top, culminating in Graveyard Carz' most emotional reveal to date.

programme.title: Commando Cuda vs. Magnum Force
programme.desc: New shop. New crew. An All-new Graveyard Carz! The ghouls tackle a 1970 Cuda.

programme.title: Rallye Red Restored
programme.desc: Mark paints a Hemi Charger in his favorite Mopar color, burnt orange. AMD delivers the Phantom Cuda, and the ghouls finish the Dailey's 1970 Cuda 383, a project four years in the making.

programme.title: Hell Hath No '58 Fury
programme.desc: The ghouls wrap up the 340 Cuda and install panels on the Hemi Charger. Mark trains Allysa on O.E.M. assembly line markings. The legendary red Plymouth Fury "Christine" visits the shop.

programme.title: 400 Magnum Misfire
programme.desc: The ghouls have problems with after-market parts for the 400 Magnum V8. Allysa begins working in the shop, and two rare Mopars are disassembled

programme.title: Return of the '70 Sunroof Challenger
programme.desc: Mark's coffee addiction is spotlighted, and the ghouls work on a 1970 Challenger.

programme.title: “Penelope” Cruise
programme.desc: This '73 Dodge Charger was pushed aside when the Barron family’s oldest daughter passed away. Now the family is ready to charge ahead and get the car running again in Kaitlyn’s honor.

programme.title: Pay It Forward
programme.desc: Katie, Collete and the Helping Hands team up with non-profit organization “Wheels of Success” to restore an Acura to provide to a hardworking single mom. The Helping Hands team will make sure "Gray Bay Bay" can stay on the road for another 100k miles.

programme.title: Creative and Disgruntled Parking
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen have their hands full with some disgruntled parkers and a creative landing by a pickup needs a little help getting off a ledge.

programme.title: Spicy Customers
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen have a day with a few folks after taking their cars to impound.

programme.title: Heated Debates
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen have a run in with the law, well sort of.

programme.title: Camping Nightmares
programme.desc: This time out, Jeff and Kristen have to rescue some people just wanting to have a nice camping experience.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Meet the Team
programme.desc: Get an exclusive look into the operations at Down Home Harley-Davidson, from sales to service. After, the crew gets together for 'Bike Night' at Lucky's bar, and gets roped into some wild biker games.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Hot Rods & Bitchin' Bikes
programme.desc: Dan and the crew plan their first big Saturday event: a massive car and motorcycle show at the dealership. Special guest Dave Kindig arrives to check out some cars and judge the competition

programme.title: Tipsy Track Car
programme.desc: When a 1969 Camaro with bad body roll is delivered to the shop, Kevin and Willie tackle the suspension to help it perform better on the track.

programme.title: A Pair of Pickups
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie build a new bed for an ongoing 1973 truck project before solving some issues with the hub assembly on a hefty F-350.

programme.title: Sweepstakes Jeep
programme.desc: Federated Auto Parts send Willie B. and Kevin a Jeep Wrangler to outfit with a new Dana 44 and a few other upgrades for a lucky winner.

programme.title: Make Some Noise
programme.desc: With a powerful Dodge Challenger in the shop for maintenance and performance upgrades, Kevin and Willie can’t resist adding on a new exhaust for the owner as well.

programme.title: Vintage M37 Engine Swap
programme.desc: When Willie and Kevin find a 1953 M37 sitting in a friend’s garage next to a Cummins 4BT and all the parts needed for an engine swap, they volunteer to provide the labor.

programme.title: Chevelle Re-Awakening
programme.desc: The guys have a sweet 1970 Chevelle in the shop with a worn-out interior and a problematic cowl induction system seal. Plus, Kevin tackles the daunting task of rebuilding an infamous Rochester Quadrajet Carburetor.

programme.title: Diamond in Dodge City
programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: Biker Lore
programme.desc: Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: Vegas Payday
programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: Second Time's a Charm
programme.desc: The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project
programme.desc: Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: Orphan Bikes
programme.desc: Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: Hollywood's Cars Come to Life at Picture Car Productions
programme.desc: Covert cars that slipped into the U.S.

programme.title: Rickey Gadson Stares Down a Steep Learning Curve at Rd. Atl
programme.desc: "Go Fast Girl" Katherne Legge's Model A Racer.

programme.title: A Sneak Peek at a Premier, Private Collection
programme.desc: Mecum Auction's push for a $15,000,000 sale.

programme.title: The World's Largest Monthly Car Show Goes Up for Sale to the Highest Bidder
programme.desc: Doubling down for cars and coffee.

programme.title: Landscaping a Home with a Nod to Automotive
programme.desc: British Invasion through the decades.

programme.title: The Fertile Car Grounds in the North Georgia Mountains
programme.desc: Due diligence on custom builds and their quirky builders.

programme.title: Cars and Coffee Takes Center Stage on Amelia Island
programme.desc: The Concourse d'lemons celebrates the oddball, mundane, & truly awful of the automotive world.

programme.title: Concourse d'lemons: One Man's Trash Is a Car Enthusiast's Treasure
programme.desc: Rickey, Bryan and Adam explore all the cars that should never have been built at Concourse d'lemons.

programme.title: Super Cars at Course d'Elegance
programme.desc: One of a kind cars at Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane.

programme.title: A New Generation Takes over Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane at Ameilia Island have everything from classic to extraterrestrial.

programme.title: Voices: Blackberry Smoke
programme.desc: A new season kicks off with some big numbers: Featuring the world's fastest C8 Corvette, an overpowered Cortina Mark I, and a Buick Regal with over 1,700 horsepower

programme.title: Voices: Bishop Rob Wright
programme.desc: C & O: North America's most diverse car show: Featuring custom Bugs, John Kaase fire breathing '56 Fords, and Chevy Silverados touching 1000HP

programme.title: Brumos Collection with Hurley
programme.desc: C & O Jacksonville: Featuring Hurley Haywood's Brumos Porsches, a street legal Indy car, and a dynamic '60 Olds

programme.title: Graffiti Artist KBMER
programme.desc: Jacksonville's C & O's colorful and quirky car culture.

programme.title: Voices: Sport's Radio Legend, Mike Bell
programme.desc: C & O: North America's greatest car show

programme.title: Voices: Killer Mike
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane: North America's greatest car show

programme.title: Fuller's Fab 5
programme.desc: Amelia Island's own Caffeine & Octane car show,: Featuring $2,000 Wrek Racing Truck, David Patterson's favorite C&O cars, a plastic Citroen Mehari, and much more.

programme.title: Generation Amelia
programme.desc: The Concours d'Elegance from Amelia Island: Featuring bomb-proof Conquest Knight XV, '69 Camaro Hagerty Fixer-Upper, and car-enthusiast John Oates.

programme.title: Delta Wing Racer with a Vengeance
programme.desc: State-of-the-art engineering and passion projects take center stage on this edition of Caffeine & Octane. The revolutionary Delta Wing Racer turns on hot lap after hot lap at Road Atlanta, and driver Katherine Legge offers insight on how “less is more” when it comes to power to weight ratios; the dark world of a graffiti artist paints a picture of a car called Vengeance while the hosts share the eclectic hybrids of machines that make it to Caffeine and Octane with Vengance’s creator Totem.

programme.title: Henry Ford III & Counterfeit Cars
programme.desc: The word is out that Caffeine & Octane is the ultimate scene and the place to be seen. Even after 12 hours of racing at the Petit Le Mans endurance race, Henry Ford III, the great grandson of Henry Ford the industrial magnate and current member of Ford’s Board of Directors, showed up to take in the sights, address the crowds, and sign a one of a kind Ford Shelby GT350R. The GT350R will hit the road with Operation Hope to encourage young people to study math and science through motorsports; Covert car counterfeiter, Chuck Beck looks for Ford’s approval on his own version of a muscled up Festiva. YouTuber ‘That Dude in Blue’ David Patterson joins Skip and Bryan to get a special look at the motor-based philanthropic outreach and amazing cars that come with it done by John Hope Bryant, friend of Caffeine and Octane.

programme.title: Go Fast Collections
programme.desc: Rickey and Bryan race outside of their comfort zones, each competing to find the raddest car collection. Rickey hangs out with classic racer, Ron Green, who shows him the ropes in the ultra light '83 Ralt RT5. Bryan visits a collection of 120 racing motorcycle owned by mechanic and racer Mike McConville. Mike takes Bryan motorcross racing in his backyard after showing off his high horsepowered car collection. Caffeine and Octane alongside Ron Green visit Atlanta's first Concours d'elegance to look at classic cars that have been perfectly maintained for decades.

programme.title: The Wrap on the Most Beautiful Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Phears’ Jaguar E-Type was nothing more than a diamond in the rough before the mineral rights attorney took on the basket case. Caffeine & Octane brings viewers the story of how Phears’, through relentless research and determination, restored and reunited the #10 Jag that Enzo Ferrari called “the most beautiful car ever made”; Atlanta Wraps shows how wrapping Corvettes and Lamborghinis can color a car fast. Caffeine and Exotics is featured again to show off the coolest wraps Atlanta can supply.

programme.title: Panoz Racing & Chasing Chevys
programme.desc: Twenty-five years of hand building record-setting race cars is no easy task. But don’t tell that to Don Panoz who takes on Porsches and Ferraris with his laid back personality and a full-production facility that makes improvised versions of Americas V-8’s; Caffeine & Octane gets an exclusive look at an elusive man’s life long pursuit of everything Chevrolet.

programme.title: Retrofitting a Psycho Mercury
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane goes old school with Psycho Deville singer and pin striper Walt Richards. Richards has less than a week to hand paint his signature flames on a way cool ’50 Mercury. An introduction to Retrofit Lighting’s trickle down technology - from cars to motorcycles - that will revolutionize how bikes will see and be seen.

programme.title: Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: 100 Year Old Harley
programme.desc: “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: Hidden Hillclimbers
programme.desc: A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: 12 Hours and Running
programme.desc: “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Meeting The King
programme.desc: Dan and Ellen get an exclusive invitation to the Richard Petty Museum to meet the 'King of Nascar' himself - Richard Petty. Petty gives a personal tour of his childhood home and garage. Back at Down Home, Rama leads a big ride into the mountains.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs 104 Bar Hopping
programme.desc: Tensions run high at the dealership as the crew plans their next big Saturday event - The Bootlegger's Run. Dan worries about the weather while he and Ellen meet with bar owners to get them on board with the ride.

programme.title: Neither Snow nor brakes nor bad phone calls
programme.desc: A mailman needs rescued, brakes go out on a vehicle and funny phone calls on this episode!

programme.title: Towpourri
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen get into a delicate mix of snappy people and trapped work vehicles.

programme.title: Diamond in Dodge City
programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: Biker Lore
programme.desc: Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: Vegas Payday
programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: Sgt. Rock Exhaust
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in SGT. ROCK to take care of steering, brakes, and the exhaust system. With a quick trip to Stainless Works for a custom set of headers and exhaust system, and with the layout of the four-wheel hydraulic steering, it won’t be long before this big military beast is rolling under its own power. After that, he takes on the seat in Heavy Metal tow truck. Just because a project may have come out of a junkyard, doesn’t mean it has to look like junk. Stacey proves that by adding a custom bomber-style seat to this already VERY unique vehicle… this episode of GEARZ is the one to see!

programme.title: Moby Duck
programme.desc: Stacey sets out to build a nice hunting rig out of a 2012 GMC 4x4 truck. But this rig belongs to John Godwin of Duck Commander, which means the truck will be spending some serious time on the road… and off… hunting for ducks. On goes a 6” lift, 35” tall tires, and massive bumpers and winch to pull this big white beast out of any mud holes it may end up in. And since it IS such a big white beast, it is only fitting that Stacey name this project “Moby Duck”! If you’ve ever wondered if it’s possible to have a daily driver, that can also be a nice hunting, fishing, or outdoor rig. This episode of GEARZ will show you how to do it.

programme.title: Super Car, Hot Rods, Go Carts
programme.desc: Stacey rolls the SL-C back into the shop to show off the twin turbo system Schwartz Performance installed. If you thought 1000hp out of an LS-7 was impossible, THINK AGAIN! Even wilder is the fact that this engine is pulling that kind of horsepower on pump gas! If supercars and twin turbos are your thing, you have to see this! After that, Stacey goes through some of the problem areas that you will face when you are building a vehicle and how to pick the right project. Finally He digs into the 1st motorized vehicle that most of us had…the Go-Kart. There's something for everybody in this show. That’s why they call it GEARZ!

programme.title: Building A Shop
programme.desc: We dig into the ultimate how-to project… building a shop! It’s an incredible transformation as Stacey and Crew take a huge open warehouse and build it into the new GEARZ shop. Along the way you’ll pick up all kinds of tips and tricks that Stacey uses when he’s setting up a useable work space. With today’s economy, there are more and more people thinking about opening a shop, or converting their existing garage space into a more useable area. This show can help you do that. After that, Stacey shows how to stop rust dead in its tracks by using the simplest tool in the box… a paint brush! It’s all here on GEARZ!

programme.title: The Gearz Express
programme.desc: Stacey makes a house call… to Pennsylvania! Why?... to pick up an old fire truck to use as a project truck to make even more house calls with! If this sounds confusing, then you NEED to see this show, because Stacey shows you how to take a vehicle that nobody really has a use for anymore, and convert it into something you can use for your home or business. Sound deadening, tool boxes, and an on-board air system are all things that you’ll see go on as the big green fire truck, begins the conversion into a rolling tool truck

programme.title: 100th Episode Pt. 1
programme.desc: It’s anniversary time…the 100th episode of GEARZ! And we have put together a one-hour special of the history and making of GEARZ, in two episodes! Stacey takes a look back at how the show came about. Then he digs into some of the project vehicles, and looks at the ideas and reasoning that shaped these trend-setting vehicles. If you’re new to GEARZ or wondered how the show was put together, this episode will shed some light on that

programme.title: Wrapping The Beast
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in the big green fire truck, with every intention of changing the color and look. But he’s not using paint… he’s using a vinyl wrap! If you’ve ever wondered what the deal is with vinyl wraps and if it is a good thing to do to your project, you need to see this show! But that’s not all, as the wrap is going on, Stacey also takes the time to show how to restore and bring back to life your accessories and trim without spending a lot of money.

programme.title: Richard Petty
programme.desc: If you’ve been around cars very much, you’ve heard the term “barn find”. It depicts that “diamond in the rough” vehicle that everybody wants to find. Stacey delves into the barn find phenomenon and unveils what could be the ultimate barn find… the lost Richard Petty Car! Follow the incredible story of the car that Richard and Maurice Petty built in their early days, that was then sold and disappeared for decades... only to be found by Stacey and returned to Richard Petty so it could take its rightful place in the Petty Museum. It’s gearhead archeology at its best, and you’ll only see it on GEARZ!

programme.title: On The Road
programme.desc: Stacey hits the road to visit a GEARZNation member to see if he can lend a hand on his project. The owner is a 16-year-old kid and the subject is his ’96 Dodge pickup that’s looking a little rough from years of use and abuse. That quickly changes as Stacey jumps in to help give the truck a new face, and at the same time offers tips and tricks to breathe a breath of fresh air into the project. See what a difference some time, expertise, and a few parts can make on a beat up old truck! After that, Stacey takes a look at the amazing Moduline Cabinets, and digs into what makes them so great.

programme.title: LMC Casey James Bronco
programme.desc: Stacey shows you how to tackle the one restoration project that everybody dreams of doing one day... the frame off restoration! You’ll be surprised how simple a job like this can be if you follow his simple tips and tricks and plan the project out properly. In the world of high dollar builds, a simple frame off restoration can get you back on the road enjoying your car or truck and at a fraction of the price. But to get a grasp on how to do it, you have to see this show. After that, Stacey swaps some licks with recording artist Casey James who just happens to be a gearhead at heart… all here… all Gearz!

programme.title: Custom Bumper Mounts
programme.desc: So, you think you want some custom bumpers for your big ol’ truck? Stacey shows you how to find what you’re looking for in the aftermarket, and also how to fabricate and build your own custom mounts to make ‘em sit exactly where you want them. After that he digs into the history of the Sgt. Rock truck and how it is permanently connected to “the greatest generation”. But this truck isn’t just about WWII, as a special tailgate airbrushed by Mickey Harris reveals, It’s about the men and women that have sacrificed for the freedoms we enjoy today. This is one show that will have you waving the flag!

programme.title: On The Road Again
programme.desc: Stacey hits the road to help out a Gearz Nation member with his ‘56 Corvette project. Since the guy really wants to drive the car, putting in a modern 5 or 6spd tranny would be really nice. But which one? Well, we not only answer that question, but also give the guy a little helping hand with the transmission too. If you’ve ever wished Stacey made house calls, this is the show to see. After that we take a look at some serious questions that people ask about becoming a tool dealer and if it’s really worth it. You wanted to know… we got the answers for you!

programme.title: The Street Sweeper
programme.desc: Stacey dives into the world of the sleeper, by taking a non-descript ’73 Plymouth Satellite, and begins transforming it into a street pounding monster under the skin. Gone is the lethargic 318 engine and front suspension, and in its place Stacey begins fitting a new state of the art performance suspension. It you are into surprising people at stop lights and run-what-you-brung race nights, then a “Street Sweeper” just might be the sort of approach you want to take on your next project.

programme.title: Street Sweeper Interior
programme.desc: If you could only do one upgrade on your vehicle, that would make the biggest impact on the looks and drivability, what would it be? Stacey answers that question by installing a Katzkin leather interior into a Jeep Compass, and showing that if you’ve got an open weekend and a few hundred bucks, you can do the same thing on your car or truck. After that, he jumps back onto the Street Sweeper project to lay out the interior and the rearend, and finally drop that huge Hemi into place. If you’ve ever thought it would be fun to build a sleeper car, this is one ’73 Plymouth Satellite that shows how it can be done!

programme.title: NAPA Perfect Additions Truck 2
programme.desc: Stacey tackles power gains at the air intake, modifies the computer and replaces the stock exhaust before addressing a 2” front-end suspension lift kit. He moves on to give the truck some extra height and support in the rear of the truck where payload weight can be a serious issue. After the suspension is in place, new wheels and tires bring the truck back down to the ground. Stacey also covers several tools that will help you get that old exhaust out from under your vehicle.

programme.title: Junkyard Jag
programme.desc: Stacey leads the crew on a hunt for a junkyard Jaguar with a rare engine. Pin-striping legend Von Hot Rod comes to the GearZ studio and lays down some lines on a hot rod guitar. Need to repair or replace the door on your pick up? Stacey’s got a handle on that. A bed lifter system turns a four-man operation into a one-man show. And Stacey’s got a steering column that will keep Falcon owners between the lines. All this and more!

programme.title: On The Road Again
programme.desc: Stacey hits the road to help out a Gearz Nation member with his ‘56 Corvette project. Since the guy really wants to drive the car, putting in a modern 5 or 6spd tranny would be really nice. But which one? Well, we not only answer that question, but also give the guy a little helping hand with the transmission too. If you’ve ever wished Stacey made house calls, this is the show to see. After that we take a look at some serious questions that people ask about becoming a tool dealer and if it’s really worth it. You wanted to know… we got the answers for you!

programme.title: Evolution Worlds Fastest Cat
programme.desc: Stacey tells the story of the legendary Cheetah and how that car was designed to beat Shelby’s famed Cobra. The GEARZ hunt for this iconic race car features the original ’63 Cheetah that Budd Clusserath drove 215 mph at Daytona in ‘64. But the story doesn’t end there, because Stacey gets his hands on a Cheetah Evolution and shows you how to build your own version of this tire shredding cat! After that, you’ll see Steering wheel options from Grant, a serpentine belt system from LMC Truck, and Wizard products to make your vehicle come alive, as well as a quick tip to get things rolling in your shop. All this and more on GearZ.

programme.title: Put A Heart In The Cat
programme.desc: Moving deeper into the build of the Cheetah Evolution, Stacey and the crew pull the skin off this cat and start putting in the guts. Overviews of suspension, steering, and brakes get this project up and running. Moving into the heart of this beast, Stacey shows us that good things do come in small packages—the LSX 454 small block is sure to get your pulse rate up. And once the transmission is mounted, look out! Headers follow, and this cat is almost ready to run. Stacey’s tool tech will give you a lift… all this and more on GearZ.

programme.title: Cheetah Paws
programme.desc: A road trip, an overview of the Cheetah interior including seat and dash installation, rear lights and a tool tech. The GearZ crew heads out on the prowl to visit a budding young mechanic with a passion for 4X4’s. Back in the garage, Stacey gets in tight with the Cheetah, installing seats and the dash. Selecting gauges and placement are discussed, an AC unit will help keep this cat cool, taillights are fitted, and the side pipes will give this Cheetah some growl! Stacey’s tool tech will keep your project on time and on budget. And Fast Orange cleans more than your hands. All this on GearZ.

programme.title: Beaten & Downtrodden
programme.desc: Auction cars and what you might really find out once the car is in your garage: suspension, brakes and electrical concerns. In the current fad of “flipping” cars for cash, Stacey takes on the good, bad, and ugly of a ’66 Biscayne that was bought at auction. Nice looking paint can’t hide the safety issues that are found once this car is put on the lift. From suspension, to brakes, to battery cables… and even down to the lug nuts, this auction beauty turns out to be more of a beast. Safety and sport-style handling are only a few repairs away this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Automotive Icon Turns 40
programme.desc: Stacey and the crew head north to celebrate 40 years of Heartthrob Exhaust and see just how far this company has come since its modest beginnings in a garage.
