After that we dig into a cracked dash and show how easy it is to replace one yourself with some aftermarket parts from LMC Truck, and then we look at a painless solution will help clean up years of spliced wires and old electrical tape that might be lurking under your hood. It’s simple gearhead stuff that everybody needs to know and it’s only on GearZ.

programme.title: Cheetah Gets Her Growl
programme.desc: Stacey digs back into the Cheetah project by finishing up the stance with custom wheels and tires, and then goes through the ins and outs of putting a classic Hilborn fuel injection on a modern LS engine… and the dyno numbers show that the engine likes it as much as you will! After that Stacey sits down with a budding car designer that is making a big impact everywhere he goes and there’s also a tip on the importance of seals and gaskets. It’s all about getting out and turning wrenches, and you’re only gonna find it on GEARZ!

programme.title: Curves On Wheels
programme.desc: Stacey explores the history of the legendary Jaguar D-type racecar and introduces a D-type Jag from Race Car Replicas that is sure to become a legend of its own. From race wheels to classic spoke wheels with true knock-offs, Stacey looks at options for getting the best look and most rubber on the road with this Jag. A tip might keep you from losing your mind when dealing with lug nuts that don’t want to budge and we talk shop about performance parts for your own cars. So, come hang out while we take on a legendary cat of a different color this week on GearZ!

programme.title: Second Time's a Charm
programme.desc: The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project
programme.desc: Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: Orphan Bikes
programme.desc: Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: 100 Year Old Harley
programme.desc: “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: Hidden Hillclimbers
programme.desc: A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: 12 Hours and Running
programme.desc: “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.title: Diamond in Dodge City
programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: Biker Lore
programme.desc: Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: Vegas Payday
programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: Boss of Hogs The Bootleggers Run
programme.desc: The Moonshiners arrive at Down Home for its biggest charity ride of the year. Excitement (and chaos) erupts at the dealership while Dan and the crew manage the unexpected crowd.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Tearing Up the Course
programme.desc: The King Richard Petty invites Dan to compete in The Richard Petty Charity Golf Classic. To 'up his game,' Dan gets a golf lesson from the best in the business. Will it be enough to impress his teammates?

programme.title: Welcome to Gatlinburg
programme.desc: Follow Jeff and Kristen Patton in the wild adventures of their towing service in the scenic and sometimes dangerous Pigeon Forge TN. This episode Jeff helps a semi driver get out of a tight turn, move a sly cone manipulator, and get a couple people off a ledge. All in a days work!

programme.title: Towventure!
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen Patton are back. This episode takes the crew to capture a stolen car and rescue a ditched car. All in a days work!

programme.title: Impala Imposter
programme.desc: Willie stumbles across a beautiful 1966 Impala, but its beauty is only skin-deep. Under the hood are rusty headers, a grimy engine block, and a host of other needed repairs. It’s up to Willie and Kevin to restore this classic to its former glory.

programme.title: Dropping that C-10
programme.desc: When the guys get their hands on a clean 1986 square-body C-10, they give it a facelift…and a suspension drop. With its brand-new look and stance, Willie and Kevin can’t wait to reveal the truck to its owner.

programme.title: Pretty Fly for a GTI
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie have an Autobahn edition 2013 MK6 VW GTI in the shop for performance upgrades. With a new turbo kit, exhaust, and a few other improvements, the guys plan to boost this car’s status from “daily driver” to “head-turner.”

programme.title: Double Truck Trouble
programme.desc: A friend of Kevin and Willie has not one, but two work trucks that need improvements for hauling heavy loads. Can the guys handle this double-order and finish both trucks in time for the owner to get them back on the job?

programme.title: Moab Ready
programme.desc: If you’re headed for the formidable Moab Desert, your Jeep had better be ready for anything. Willie and Kevin are outfitting a Wrangler TJ and a Cherokee XJ to handle the harsh environment of the desert.

programme.title: WeatherTech Bound
programme.desc: Kevin hits the road to Bolingbrook, Illinois to find out what it takes to proudly display “Made in America”, as he tours WeatherTech to see how they make all those great American products.

programme.title: BURIED TREASURE
programme.desc: Ray finds Buried Treasures in the form of two race cars that had been left almost completely untouched since the last time they were on a race track. One is found sitting in a barn with the other trapped in an old car hauler. Upon uncovering the cars, we find both have big stories to tell.

programme.title: INDY RESCUE
programme.desc: A journey to Indianapolis unveils the winning car of the 1955 Indy 500 sits on the roof of an auto mechanic shop. More than 50 years after it’s magic at the track, prominent Indy mechanic/owner Chris Paulsen begins to restore the car and Ray talks about the evolution of America’s illustrious Indy 500.

programme.title: SMOKEY
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Smokey Yunick, the most innovative mechanic in NASCAR history, sold his famous truck that hauled equipment & cars across the country. Ray is on a mission to uncover this storied truck that helped launch the beginning of NASCAR’s cross-country popularity.

programme.title: VANDERBILT
programme.desc: Ray travels to Long Island, New York with the hopes of learning more about America’s first major auto racing competition. The race, which began at the turn of the 20th century, helped develop the first major American racing stars and drove American manufacturing to competitive standard with the highly progressive Europeans.

programme.title: RAYS ROOTS
programme.desc: Fred Dmuchowski is a New Jersey racing icon. He was a regular workingman who raced on weekends for fun and became a legend in his iconic 303 racer. Ray works to rebuild the 303 in homage to Fred who inspired him to pursue his career in motorsports.

programme.title: THE CORVETTE
programme.desc: For Rick Hendrick, the Corvette inspired his first car purchase, which ultimately led to the creation of his car dealership empire and motorsports teams. Mr. H, as he goes by, gives us a rare look inside of his personal Corvette collection and takes us to General Motors World Headquarters to talk with GM Vice President of Global Design, Ed Welburn, about how this iconic car came about. Country superstar Brad Paisley makes a cameo appearance to talk about his prized ‘Vette and the influence of cars on his music.

programme.title: ELVIS VAULT
programme.desc: The last car Elvis drove the evening he passed was his beloved Stutz Blackhawk. Ray discovers that the car has been preserved and heads to Graceland to check out this iconic piece of American music history. Ray and the team reveal the impeccable preservation of the car at Charlotte Motor Speedway with Rick Hendrick (“Mr. H”) and, arguably Elvis Presley’s biggest fan, Dale Earnhardt Jr. While at Graceland, Ray and the team also get an exclusive look at the paneled station wagon Elvis used to get in and out of Graceland in disguise. It’s an intimate look at the King’s incredible automobiles and their secrets that only Elvis knew.

programme.title: BAND OF BROTHERS
programme.desc: This episode takes an inside look at the famous racing L88 Corvette. From its history, to its successes and heartbreaks, to the stories of the men that drove it. Now, it’s a car world’s version of the Flinstones meet the Jetsons, as the Owens Corning Corvette, which clinched 22 straight race victories, challenges the new Corvette C7-R at Sebring International Raceway. The original Owens Corning team reunites for the challenge and our crew goes behind the scenes for the Corvette test drive of a lifetime.

programme.title: BREAK UP TO MAKEUP
programme.desc: From break up to make up, Jeff Gordon and Ray reunite to go on a quest to find their Chevrolet Monte Carlo that claimed victory in their final race together at Phoenix, AZ in 1999. John Bickford, Jeff Gordon’s stepdad, makes the call that reunites the old team. Jeff and Ray look to bum parts off their boss, Rick Hendrick, to make their vision a reality: get the car, replace the parts as they were, make it run and get it to auction.

programme.title: BATTLE FOR ROME
programme.desc: One of the greatest battles in NASCAR history was Hall of Famer Richie Evans and rival speedster Jerry Cook. Ray is determined to uncover and revive the cars that made these men famous.Ray purchases one of Richie’s original #61 modifieds from Jimmy Spencer and restores it to its original glory while simultaneously building a replica of Jerry Cook’s #38. Throughout the build process, Ray uncovers stories about these legends through the eyes of guys who were in Rome, NY to witness it firsthand, like Robin Pemberton and Steve Hmiel.Both cars will hit the track at Martinsville, site of one of the greatest races in modified history and the tragic death of Richie Evans himself. Legends live again, as Ray recreates one of the racing world’s most celebrated rivalries on a track that has seen it all.

programme.title: Second Time's a Charm
programme.desc: The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: Wounded Warrior Project
programme.desc: Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: Orphan Bikes
programme.desc: Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: SECRETS OF GM
programme.desc: General Motors VP of global design Ed Welburn takes AmeriCarna behind the scenes to talk about the history and development of the company’s concept cars that never made it to production. In a rare tour of the factory’s inner design studio, Ray gets an exclusive look behind the creative curtain at the GM plant in Detroit.

programme.title: FIRST MUSTANG
programme.desc: In this episode, Ray celebrates the 50th birthday of the Ford Mustang through the lens of three distinct Mustang owners, who each hold a slice of the car’s incredible history. In 1964, Chicago schoolteacher Gail Wise unknowingly purchased the first ever Mustang 3 days before the car became available to the general public. Her husband reveals the incredible restoration that brought the earliest Mustang ever sold back to its 60’s glory. (Ford Motor Company knows she has the car and has verified it was sold before it was legal to sell.) John Grafelman is a farmer in Illinois and life-long Ford lover. A few years ago he found an old car hidden in a barn. It took some time, but he eventually convinced his friend to sell it to him. After some detective work, he discovers he purchased 1968 Ford Design Chief Larry Shinoda’s personal car that he tinkered with to invent the BOSS 302.Lastly, Ray travels to Dayton Ohio to interview Gale Holderman, the Ford stylist who won the company’s contest to draw and design the Mustang.

programme.title: FORGOTTEN FIBERGLASS
programme.desc: Post-World War II, a large generation of American soldiers was looking for cars that mirrored the incredible sports cars they saw overseas in Europe. After searching for an affordable way to recreate these cars, one manufacturer responded with a durable, cost effective option: a line of fiberglass sports cars. Very few of these cars still exist but there are collectors who are constantly looking to save parts and pieces of these virtually unknown vehicles. We learn about these rare cars from Geoff Hacker and his team at Forgotten Fiberglass, and take a visit to the Smithsonian Museum, which houses a fiberglass car of its own. This episode presents a unique look at how the narrative of American wartime experiences often shaped the nation’s automotive demands.

programme.title: DISCOVERIES IN JERSEY
programme.desc: Ray explores buying a unique, hand built car the Schultz family has kept in their New Jersey home for years. The car was originally called the Schultz El Fierro but it’s officially titled in New Jersey as a “Schultz Special” from 1958. It was used to drag race and held numerous racing records, but most important to the family was that it was driven by the legendary Carroll Shelby. With a frame and style much similar to the Shelby Roadster, the Schultz family wonders if it inspired one of the most well known automobiles in America. In another epic New Jersey story, Ray finds Mario Andretti’s 1965 IndyCar. The catch: it’s completely in pieces hidden away in a garage. The iconic driver talks about his days on the track with that car and Ray attempts to negotiate a deal to buy the parts.

programme.title: MOVIE CARS
programme.desc: How do you cast a car in a movie? What are the secrets to the build? Hollywood car designers give Ray the ultimate tour of some memorable movie cars, including a look at the recently found “Hells Chariot”, the last surviving car from Grease. We also hear the backstory to “Bumble Bee” from Transformers, take a look at the making of the tanks for Hunger Games and stumble upon the iconic 1958 Chevy Impala from American Graffiti.

programme.title: HOT ROD HOLY GRAIL
programme.desc: While visiting the estate of automotive genius and land speed record holder Willie Glass, Ray uncovers a set of extremely rare Ardun cylinder heads, which is a hot rodders dream discovery. He also visits the infamous H & H Flatheads outside of Los Angeles and discovers a surprise connection to the Earnhardt family.

programme.title: CORVETTE SINK HOLE
programme.desc: A massive sinkhole opened underneath the National Corvette Museum in Kentucky. Eight amazing cars were swallowed up, including the 1,000,000th Corvette. AmeriCarna was given exclusive access to document the removal of the cars from the sinkhole and the painstaking restoration of the 1,000,000th Corvette.

programme.title: Beetles, Bugs, and Buses, Oh My!
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane is known for having something for everyone. That reputation is tested when over 100 VW’s, on the lunatic fringe of automotive, rattled into an event. The annual VW Invasion has swarmed C&O, bringing with it Bugs, Beetles, Buses and more by a very dedicated VW fan base.

programme.title: Big Tigger v. Monster Muscle
programme.desc: Rapper, radio, and ATL TV personality Darian “Big Tigger” Morgan invites Caffeine & Octane into his home. Cameras look past his collection of 500 Michael Jordan shoes to focus their lenses on a one-off motorcycle the 6–time NBA Champion gave to Tigger as a gift; A second to none, muscle car collection by one of the founders of Monster Energy gets toured by one of our hosts.

programme.title: Exotic Car Hunter
programme.desc: Vintage Testarossas and Quatra Valve Ferraris don’t just show up on a dealer’s floor, they’re hunted! Adam Merlin, exotic car expert, has spent a lifetime searching for the cars that defined his youth, but nothing is assumed or given in his high stakes game of Risk; A muscle car fiend shows off his private collection to host Skip Smith.

programme.title: Andruw Jones' Super Jeep
programme.desc: The word is out that Caffeine & Octane is the major league of North American car shows. Former Atlanta Brave, World Series star, and 10-Time Gold Glove winner Andruw Jones acknowledged the stardom and showed up to show off his 6 wheeled Super Jeep. The state of the art creation took years in planning and execution, but Jones chooses one great event for its debut.

programme.title: Jekyll and Hide
programme.desc: The natural landscape of Jekyll Island, GA makes for a great backdrop to showcase the country’s greatest cars. But the ocean air and remoteness of this GA barrier island is no place to leave a painstakingly rebuilt ‘59 Imperial Speedster. Host Skip Smith makes it his mission to locate the talented builder behind this island mystery. Guest host Totem joins Bryan Fuller in the C&O lots to pick out his favorites.

programme.title: Big Yellow Taxi
programme.desc: Imagination, ingenuity, and heartache join friends who set out with a simple goal of transforming a ‘35 Plymouth into a running taxi cab. Provenance and passion take center stage as families and friends strive for best in show. Host Rickey Gadson checks out perfect replicas of the original Shelby Cobras and takes Skip and Bryan on ‘borrowed’ taxi ride.

programme.title: Peach State Challengers
programme.desc: Call the Peach State Challengers a “car club” and you will quickly be corrected. The defenders of everything Dodge are “family” and they make no excuses for their loyalty to brand and brother. Spend a day at the track with these Challengers and find out what their version of the family photo looks like.

programme.title: Lambo Racer
programme.desc: Former Jet Ski Champion Ryan Hardwick has succeeded in everything he’s touched in racing and business, so why not race Lamborghinis! Hardwick has found rapid success with his high tech training methods; he shares his secrets with host Rickey Gadson in this episode of C&O.

programme.title: Boston's (Un)Common Collection
programme.desc: Daimlers and Morgans, and Citroens, oh my! Caffeine & Octane is known for having something for everyone. That reputation grows stronger as Bob Boston’s collection, on the lunatic fringe of automotive, rattles into an event; guest host Katherine Legge explains the competitor to her racing sponsor Acura, Porsche.

programme.title: C&O at the Beach
programme.desc: Early spring in Jekyll Island, GA is something to behold. Add a few hundred of the country’s coolest rides for Caffeine & Octane at the Beach, and it’s a thing of beauty. Models that blasted the glass ceiling of expectation at the all makes and models show include a hand-built, twin-turbo Tucker, a one-off 1951 Kaiser Drag’N, and a Roadkill Custom known only as Blasphemi!

programme.title: Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: 100 Year Old Harley
programme.desc: “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Tearing Up the Course
programme.desc: The King Richard Petty invites Dan to compete in The Richard Petty Charity Golf Classic. To 'up his game,' Dan gets a golf lesson from the best in the business. Will it be enough to impress his teammates?

programme.title: Boss of Hogs Season Finale
programme.desc: Dan looks back on the dealership's performance over the past year, and continues his quest for Down Home to become #1 in the country. Will he succeed? Or does he still have some work to do?

programme.title: Towrrific!
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen meet an irate young man parked illegally then swing over to get a mom out of a predicament. All in a days work!

programme.title: Theme Parks and Trailers!
programme.desc: Jeff and Kristen work a food truck out of a windy road at a major theme park then on to a fifth wheel that is eating dirt. All in a days work!

programme.title: New Bed Old Ford
programme.desc: Stacey and the crew hit the ground running with a late model replacement bed from LMC that’s sure to revive and old Ford farm truck and get it out of the pastures and back on the highway. Then it’s off to show budding Jeep enthusiasts a couple of entry level options they can use when it comes to modifying their vehicle. We get a visit from a couple who learn how to install new seat upholstery. Stacey’s found something cool for all you second generation Camaro owners. And we’re just getting started! So get ready to turn some wrenches on GearZ.

programme.title: Gearz On The Road
programme.desc: The GearZ crew and Cornwell Tools team up to help a new shop in Arkansas get some much-needed tools to help them take they’re shop the next level. Then Stacey puts together the final pieces of the Sgt. Rock project by making a trip to France and the beaches of Normandy. Then it’s back to the shop to show you how easy it is to put fuel injection on your muscle car. It’s all here… and only on GEARZ!

programme.title: Nuts Bolts Building Sgt Rock
programme.desc: Season 10 Starts off with America’s favorite military tribute truck! Sgt. Rock is back and ready for final assembly! Garage Guru, Stacey David, takes us on a tour de force of custom fabrication as he covers all the nuts and bolts of what it’s taken to get Sgt. Rock ready to rumble. Builders of all levels are in for a great show as Stacey tackles one of a kind steering columns, gas pedals and designing a console that not only fits form, but also function. Gauge techs will keep your instrument panels in line. And a quick tip will keep your wires from fraying and your hoses from splitting. All this and more as Sgt. Rock and Season 10 hit the road full throttle.

programme.title: Sgt Rock Interior Other Details
programme.desc: A custom build can lose some power if the theme doesn’t stay consistent. Stacey shows how to do that by taking you through the process of how to make door and kick panels that keep the rugged military WWII bomber vibe flowing throughout the interior of Sgt. Rock. After that, its some tips on how to fit a radiator and that all-important cooling fan in a place where space is limited. Finally, the gas tank and battery placement are critical on a custom vehicle and Stacey goes through the steps in doing that as well. If you’ve always wanted to build a custom vehicle, this episode is sure to get your fabrication gearZ turning.

programme.title: Asessing Unfinished Project
programme.desc: Two things are certain in life: death and taxes. We all know what to do with taxes, but what happens when a loved one passes and leaves behind an unfinished project vehicle? How do you know what’s sitting in your garage? And how can you find out? Stacey tackles these questions and takes you on a thorough inventory of an almost finished restoration that was left to a widow when her husband suddenly died. A new dash going into your vehicle? A gauge tech should keep you from crossing your wires. And we’ve got tips that should help with battery relocation and lining up your vehicle’s body panels.

programme.title: Gearz On The Road - Basic Tools
programme.desc: The GearZ crew mount up and head out to visit a young gear-head whose love of wrenching started with 4-wheelers and has grown to include 4-wheel drive pick ups. Young Adam has a few surprises in store as Stacey visits him in his Dad’s garage and discusses tools, storage and tearing apart things to see how they work. Then, it’s back in the shop as Stacey takes on the big question every gear-head has: What OTHER tools should I have in my box? A look beyond the typical wrenches, hammers and clamps will show you what you may need and what you may not, depending on your project.

programme.title: Cheetah Body Work Latches Custom Exhaust
programme.desc: The son of legendary car builder, Bill Thomas, talks shop about wrenching, racing and his father’s Cobra Killer…the Cheetah. Then Stacey heads over to Stainless Works to check out how the Cheetah’s custom side pipes, headers and mufflers came together. A Gauge Tech explains the pros and cons of mechanical vs. electric gauges. After that, a Quick Tip explains the proper way to use some of those mystery tools laying around in your tool box.

programme.title: Old Dog New Truck
programme.desc: Ever wonder why your wife or best buddy won’t step foot in your late model truck? It could be that crusty interior. Tag along as Stacey takes on the sights and smells of an ’83 Chevy in dire need of some attention. From new dash to leather on the bench seat and new carpet in the floor, Stacey shows you what a difference a weekend and some parts from LMC can make. Speaking of trucks, Stacey raises the bar with a bed lifter that will make you the most popular guy in your neighborhood. A new buffer is going to help add some shine to your vehicle and a creeper that’s simply “Magic” is sure to raise an eyebrow or two. Big things are happening in the garage this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Reviving An Old Snowcat
programme.desc: Through the years, we’ve had some amazing vehicles featured on GearZ—from elite racecars to the insanity of a V-8 barstool. Well, here we go again! Stacey hauls in a Thiokol Imp that needs some…attention. First things first with this crazy snowcatmobile; we’ve got to see if we can make it run. Follow along as Stacey takes you through the ins and outs of getting a neglected vehicle up and running again. For you performance BMW guys, a tuner from Dinan is going add the horses you’ve been looking for. We’ve got sparks flying, fuel splashing and all kinds of garage mayhem this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Wiring Sgt Rock
programme.desc: In the world of car building there are few things more ominous than missing titles or VIN numbers. But there is one task that stands out, one that brings grown men to tears, one that is usually lurking behind 100 yards of electrical tape…WIRING. Well hold on tight as Stacey dives head first into wiring Sergeant Rock. That’s right; see how painless Stacey can make wiring the big old truck. Follow along as Stacey moves front to back and gets the Rock one step closer to hitting the road!

programme.title: New AC Old Chevy
programme.desc: With summer in full swing, it’s time to cool down that classic truck of yours. That’s right, roll those windows up and feel the cool breeze as Stacey shows just how easy it is to install this complete AC system from LMC Truck. Now that you’re done sweatin’, let’s take a look at headers and intakes and get that motor performing the way it should. And don’t miss out on the ins and outs of turbos and super-chargers…which one fits your needs? All this and plenty of sparks in the garage this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Building A Better Tool
programme.desc: Stacey and the GearZ crew heat things up as they head to the Cornwell forges to watch molten steel be expertly transformed into America’s best ratchet. Get ready to see sparks fly. But the trip doesn’t stop there. Tag along as the crew follows what it takes for a ratchet to end up on a Cornwell truck. Back in the garage, Stacey talks maximizing boost and the role of intercoolers when it comes to super-chargers and turbos. The wheels keep turning and the rubber keeps burning, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: On The Road - 67 Ford
programme.desc: Cheetah lovers will be excited to see Stacey’s solution to keeping the headers both cool and looking red hot. Want to keep using your stock tank after converting to fuel injection? Get psyched, because Holley has a new fuel pump that’s going to make your life a whole lot easier. Think your car is buttoned up tight? Stacey and some friends from Redline Detection blow smoke at the old soap and water test and show you how to really test for leaks in your vehicle. It’s a world of problems out there, but Stacey’s got you covered in the garage. All this and more, this week, on GearZ.

programme.title: Novas BBQ
programme.desc: This week Stacey and crew head to Memphis, TN to help out a local BBQ pitmaster who’s deep into a ground up rebuild of a ’72 Nova. The big challenge here?...Can you swap out an automatic transmission with a manual without losing your mind? Well, Stacey is always up for a good challenge and he’ll show you just how simple this swap can be. A new tuner from Super chips will make your Jeep life easier, and replacement dashes for Chevy owners are going to light up their eyes. There’s a lot going on in the garage this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Cheap Fuel Injection Snow Cat Bed TN Electric Guitar
programme.desc: We’re winding up the tenth season of GearZ, and what a season it’s been! But we’ve got some business to take care of before we move onto season eleven. First things first…Holley just made an EFI even easier to install on your carbureted vehicle, and Stacey will show you just how on target the Sniper is. The Thiokol Imp gets a suspension upgrade to keep it on track. And there’s a new kind of off-roading that’s sweeping the nation…see what RC4WD has going on. And what season would be complete without guitars? Check out Tennessee Electric Company as Stacey introduces a new guitar-maker whose custom guitars are hotter than the asphalt at the drag strip.

programme.title: The SL-C’s Hit the Road
programme.desc: We’re back and taking it to the streets! Season 11 comes roaring back with a look at Super Lite Cars on the road and the track! Stacey recalls and earlier SLC build and introduces two SLC builders who took a very hands-on approach to putting their cars together. These street/race cars are sure to catch your eye and get your racing blood flowing. If there’s one thing Stacey preaches on every episode, it’s paying attention to the details. His quick tip is no exception, getting rid of those sharp edges and nasty welds to give your project the small details that people will notice. Side mirrors for a muscle car, building a better battery, and keeping your air flowing through carbon fiber vents fill out the parts bin. We’ve got all this and more as Stacey kicks of his 11th season of GearZ!

programme.title: Sgt. Rock Lives!
programme.desc: This is the moment you’ve been waiting for! Master car builder, Stacey David, shows off the truck that’s had the nation talking for ten years! Take a look back at the kid with the dream. Follow the design and fabrication. See what happens when the military tribute vehicle rolls out and conquers the road! This episode is gonna be epic. It’s been a long road, but anything worth doing well is worth the wait. This week, the wait is over. Sergeant Rock Lives!

programme.title: On the Road & Unicure Spray Booths
programme.desc: Things are rockin’ and rollin’ in and out of the GearZ garage. Stacey hits the road to find a project build that will get gear heads buzzing. He ends up with an ’81 Camaro and some awesome stories from the seller. If you’re talking project vehicles, you’ve got to talk paint! And Stacey does just that with folks from Unicure, who specialize in paint booths and helping you get set up for that all important paint job. The V-8 Interceptor is back from a trip to Stainless works, where a custom exhaust system was made for the big Boss Nine engine. Things are about to get loud, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: The Return of Heavy Metal & Snowcat
programme.desc: Stacey and the GearZ crew roll in an old favorite: Heavy Metal. The coolest hotrod tow truck is back in the garage and ready for a facelift. Our good friends at the Hot Rod Institute drop by and talk shop with Stacey about his plans for the paint and fab work needed to get this bad boy looking good and back on the road. Fresh from the sandblaster, the snowcat reveals the scars that were under the skin. And with the drive train out, Stacey walks through the importance of replacing gaskets, seals and checking for wear and tear before stuffing that engine, transmission and skid steer rear end back into the cat. There’s a whole lot going on this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stunt Double
programme.desc: Every gear head has a secret: they all want to drive like McQueen in Bullitt, or Vin Diesel in The Fast And The Furious. But when the heat gets turned up, even some really good drivers can’t keep up. That’s when you bring in the Stunt Double! This week Stacey sits down with legendary Hollywood stunt man Ian Quinn to talk crashing cars and keeping actors out of harms way. There’s also a new project in the garage: The Stunt Double, a build inspired by the 80’s tv show The Fall Guy, and sure to get all four wheels off the ground before Stacey’s done with it. Sparks are going to fly and you know we’re gonna have a good time this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stunt Double
programme.desc: Every gear head has a secret: they all want to drive like McQueen in Bullitt, or Vin Diesel in The Fast And The Furious. But when the heat gets turned up, even some really good drivers can’t keep up. That’s when you bring in the Stunt Double! This week Stacey sits down with legendary Hollywood stunt man Ian Quinn to talk crashing cars and keeping actors out of harms way. There’s also a new project in the garage: The Stunt Double, a build inspired by the 80’s tv show The Fall Guy, and sure to get all four wheels off the ground before Stacey’s done with it. Sparks are going to fly and you know we’re gonna have a good time this week on GearZ.

programme.title: SPEEDVISION
programme.desc: The definitive automotive entertainment and lifestyle brand.
